instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165 Cycling
threads.message: This board came in looking very clean. I can't find any significant signs of a spill. It's cycling the CPU. I can't find any shorts anywhere. 3V42, PPBUS 3V3_S5, 5V_S5 are all stable. I attached pre-ultrasonic cleaning pictures. Not sure of a good next step.

threads.title: 820-00165 Cycling
threads.message:
I don't see any reason to use UC there.
Did it change its behaviour after that?

Check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and traces/solders around U6100/01.
Try new BIOS also.
Do you get 3V at pins 7 & 3 of U1950?
